unnormalised: What's the deal with all these entrance exams for college? It's like, you finish 12th, right? And then BAM! Suddenly you gotta prep for CET, NEET, JEE, and a bunch of other stuff depending on what you wanna study. My cousin, Priya, she's aiming for a BSc in Computer Science. She's already given her 12th board exams and is now stressing about the CUET UG 2024. It's mad, ya? Plus, each college also has its own cut-off marks, sometimes as high as 98%! How do they even expect students to get those kinds of scores?
normalised: What's the deal with all these entrance exams for college? It's like, you finish twelfth, right? And then BAM! Suddenly you gotta prep for C-E-T, N-E-E-T, J-E-E, and a bunch of other stuff depending on what you wanna study. My cousin, Priya, she's aiming for a B-S-c in Computer Science. She's already given her twelfth board exams and is now stressing about the C-U-E-T U-G two thousand and twenty four. It's mad, ya? Plus, each college also has its own cut-off marks, sometimes as high as ninety eight percent! How do they even expect students to get those kinds of scores?

unnormalised: And then there's the whole coaching classes scene. Everyone's joining them. It's become like, if you don't go to a coaching centre, you're basically doomed. My friend Rakesh spent ₹50,000 on coaching classes and he's still unsure if he'll get into his dream college. It's a lot of pressure on kids, especially considering how expensive education has become. Plus, you need to fill forms for each and every college separately and pay the application fees, like ₹500 per form!
normalised: And then there's the whole coaching classes scene. Everyone's joining them. It's become like, if you don't go to a coaching center, you're basically doomed. My friend Rakesh spent rupee fifty thousand on coaching classes and he's still unsure if he'll get into his dream college. It's a lot of pressure on kids, especially considering how expensive education has become. Plus, you need to fill forms for each and every college separately and pay the application fees, like rupee five hundred per form!

unnormalised: Honestly, the whole higher education admission process feels super complicated. There needs to be a simpler, more accessible system, no? One where it’s not just about marks, but also about skill and aptitude. It's making my head spin just thinking about it, and I'm not even applying this year! I hope Priya gets into a good college, though. She's worked really hard, and honestly deserves it.

One where it’s not just about marks, but also about skill and aptitude. It's making my head spin just thinking about it, and I'm not even applying this year!
